sections.title: Turn Savings Into Sustainable Retirement Income
sections.subtitle: Coordinate Social Security, pensions, and portfolios to support your lifestyle for decades

sections.title: What You'll Build
items: Withdrawal strategy integrating the 4% rule, guardrails, or buckets
Social Security claiming analysis based on longevity assumptions
Inflation and healthcare cost contingency plan

sections.title: Layered Income
sections.content: Cover essential expenses with guaranteed income first (Social Security, pensions, annuities). Use investment portfolios and part-time income for discretionary goals, adjusting withdrawal rates when markets fluctuate.

points.title: Guardrails
points.description: Adjust withdrawals up or down when portfolio values hit predetermined thresholds to preserve longevity.

points.title: Tax Coordination
points.description: Sequence withdrawals from taxable, tax-deferred, and Roth accounts to minimize lifetime taxes.

points.title: Healthcare Buffer
points.description: Set aside funds for Medicare premiums, long-term care, and out-of-pocket costs before increasing discretionary spending.

sections.title: Delay Social Security When Feasible
sections.content: Every year you delay benefits past full retirement age boosts payments ~8%, providing valuable longevity insurance.

sections.title: Retirement Income Workshop
steps: List guaranteed income sources with start dates and amounts.
Identify your desired lifestyle costs and categorize them into needs vs. wants.
Choose a withdrawal framework (bucket, guardrail, or hybrid) and map how portfolio assets support each bucket.
Model Social Security claiming ages (62, FRA, 70) to compare lifetime benefits.
Stress-test your plan using pessimistic market returns and higher inflation scenarios.
